description: a(n) = smallest prime p(k) such that the gaps between the primes p(k), p(k+1), p(k+2), ..., p(k+n) are 2, 4, 6, ... 2n.
references: Steven Kahan, 2-4-6-8...Prime Gaps That Appreciate, J. Rec. Math., Vol. 25 #1, pp. 44-46, 1993
formula: a(n)=Min{x : x=prime; {x+2k}=primes following x for k=1, .., n}
example: Consider consecutive primes 347, 349, 353, 359, 367. The gaps are 2, 4, 6, 8, so a(4)=347.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_
